document.title:
The inhomogeneous heat equation on
T

para.p: In this note I am working out some material following Steve Shkoller’s MAT218: Lecture Notes on Partial Differential Equations. However, I have written out a number of details that were not in the original notes, and may thus have introduced errors that were not in the notes on which this is based.

Write
= T
⁢
/ R 2
π Z
, and for
1 ≤ p < ∞
,

Math.text: (norm@(f)) _ (L ^ p) = ((1 / (2 * pi)) * (integral _ T)@((absolute-value@(f * t)) ^ p * differential-d@(t))) ^ (1 / p)

para.p: Define

Math.text: (norm@(f)) _ (H ^ k) = ((sum _ (0 less= j less= k))@(((norm@(((partial-differential _ x) ^ j)@(f))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2)) ^ (1 / 2)

para.p:
If
u
is a distribution on
T
,
∂ x
u
is also a distribution on
T
, and in particular, if
∈ u
⁢
L 2
( T )
then
∂ x
u
is a distribution on
T
. But if
∈ u
⁢
H 2
( T )
, for example, then
∂ x
2
u
is an element of
⁢
L 2
( T )
, rather than merely being a distribution.

Fix
> T 0
. Let
∈ f
⁢
L 2
( 0 , T ;
⁢
L 2
( T )
)
and
∈ g
⁢
H 1
( T )
; as
⊂
⁢
H 1
( T )
⁢
C 0
( T )
, we can speak about the value of
g
at every point rather than merely almost all points.

For almost all
t
and for all
x
, define
f n
by

Math.text: f _ n * open-interval@(x, t) = ((sum _ (k = - n)) ^ n)@(hat@(f) * open-interval@(k, t) * e ^ (i * k * x))

para.p:
and for all
x
define
g n
by

Math.text: g _ n * x = ((sum _ (k = - n)) ^ n)@(hat@(g) * k * e ^ (i * k * x))

para.p:
In other words, if
=
⁢
D n
( x )
∑
= k
- n
n
e
⁢ i k x
, then

Math.text: formulae@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, t) = D _ n * f * open-interval@(cdot, t) * x, g _ n * x = D _ n * g * x)

para.p: where

Math.text: phi * psi * x = (1 / (2 * pi)) * (integral _ T)@(phi * y * psi * (x - y) * differential-d@(y))

para.p:
For each
n
, assume that there is some
∈
u n
⁢
C ∞
( 0 , T ;
⁢
C ∞
( T )
)
such that for almost all
t
and for all
∈ x T
,

Math.text: u _ (n * t) * open-interval@(x, t) - u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(x, t) = f _ n * open-interval@(x, t)

para.p:
and for all
∈ x T
,

Math.text: u _ n * open-interval@(x, 0) = g _ n * x

para.p:
We will thus obtain a formula for
u n
. In fact we will not necessarily have
∈
u n
⁢
C ∞
( 0 , T ;
⁢
C ∞
( T )
)
, but once we have an expression for
u n
we can determine the function space of which it is an element. We will then show that there is some
u
in a certain function space such that
=
⁢
u n
( x , t )
⁢
(
⁢
*
D n
u
( ⋅ , t )
)
( x )
for all
x
and
t
.

For all
t
and
x
,

Math.text: u _ n * open-interval@(x, t) = (sum _ (k element-of Z))@(widehat@(u _ n) * open-interval@(k, t) * e ^ (i * k * x))

para.p:
Then () becomes the statement that for almost all
t
and for all
x
,

Math.text: (sum _ (k element-of Z))@((widehat@(u _ n)) ^ prime * open-interval@(k, t) * e ^ (i * k * x)) + (sum _ (k element-of Z))@(k ^ 2 * widehat@(u _ n) * open-interval@(k, t) * e ^ (i * k * x)) = ((sum _ (k = - n)) ^ n)@(hat@(f) * open-interval@(k, t) * e ^ (i * k * x))

para.p:
If
>
| k |
n
, then
=
+
⁢
^
u n
′
( k , t )
⁢
k 2
^
u n
( k , t )
0
, which is a linear ordinary differential equation, whose solution satisfies
=
⁢
^
u n
( k , t )
⁢
e
-
⁢
k 2
t
^
u n
( k , 0 )
. Since
=
⁢
u n
( x , 0 )
⁢
g n
( x )
,
=
⁢
^
u n
( k , 0 )
0
. Hence if
>
| k |
n
then
=
⁢
^
u n
( k , t )
0
. If
≤
| k |
n
, then for almost all
t
,
=
+
⁢
^
u n
′
( k , t )
⁢
k 2
^
u n
( k , t )
⁢
^ f
( k , t )
. The solution of this is, for all
t
and for all
x
,

Math.text: widehat@(u _ n) * open-interval@(k, t) = e ^ (- k ^ 2 * t) * widehat@(g _ n) * k + e ^ (- k ^ 2 * t) * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(e ^ (k ^ 2 * s) * widehat@(f _ n) * open-interval@(k, s) * differential-d@(s))

para.p:
Hence, for all
t
and for all
x
,

Math.text: u _ n * open-interval@(x, t) = ((sum _ (k = - n)) ^ n)@((e ^ (- k ^ 2 * t) * widehat@(g _ n) * k + e ^ (- k ^ 2 * t) * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(e ^ (k ^ 2 * s) * widehat@(f _ n) * open-interval@(k, s) * differential-d@(s))) * e ^ (i * k * x))

para.p:
We merely know that
⁢
^
f n
( k , t )
is defined for almost all
t
, thus we only know for almost all
∈
t 0
( 0 , T )
and for all
x
that
⁢
u
⁢ n t
( x ,
t 0
)
exists. We do have that

Math.text: u _ n element-of C ^ 0 * vector@(0, T, C ^ infinity * T)

para.p:
For almost all
t
, multiply () by
⁢
u n
( x , t )
and integrate over
T
. This is,

Math.text: (integral _ T)@(u _ (n * t) * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x)) - (integral _ T)@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x)) = (integral _ T)@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x))

para.p: Integrating by parts this becomes

Math.text: (integral _ T)@(u _ (n * t) * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x)) + (integral _ T)@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x)) = (integral _ T)@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x))

para.p: which is

Math.text: (pi cdot (partial-differential _ t)@(1 / (2 * pi))) * (integral _ T)@(u _ n * (open-interval@(x, t)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x)) + ((2 * pi) cdot (1 / (2 * pi))) * (integral _ T)@(u _ (n * x) * (open-interval@(x, t)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x)) = (integral _ T)@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x))

para.p: Writing this using norms,

Math.text: pi cdot (partial-differential _ t)@(((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2) + (2 * pi) cdot ((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 = (integral _ T)@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x))

para.p:
Integrating from
0
to
t
, for any
t
,

Math.text: (pi cdot ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 - pi cdot ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, 0))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2) + 2 * pi * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) = ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@((integral _ T)@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, s) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, s) * differential-d@(x) * differential-d@(s)))

para.p:
For almost all
s
,

Math.text: (integral _ T)@(absolute-value@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, s) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, s)) * differential-d@(x)) = ((2 * pi) cdot (1 / (2 * pi))) * (integral _ T)@(absolute-value@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, s) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, s)) * differential-d@(x)) less= ((2 * pi) cdot (norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) * (norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2) less= 2 * pi * (((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 / 2 + ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 / 2) = pi cdot ((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + pi cdot ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2
(integral _ T)@(absolute-value@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, s) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, s)) * differential-d@(x))
((2 * pi) cdot (1 / (2 * pi))) * (integral _ T)@(absolute-value@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, s) * u _ n * open-interval@(x, s)) * differential-d@(x))
((2 * pi) cdot (norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) * (norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)
2 * pi * (((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 / 2 + ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 / 2)
pi cdot ((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + pi cdot ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2

para.p:
It follows that for all
t
(not just almost all
t
)

Math.text: (pi cdot ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 - pi cdot ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, 0))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2) + 2 * pi * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) less= ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(pi cdot ((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2) + (pi cdot ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2) * d * s

para.p:
so, as
=
⁢
u n
( x , 0 )
⁢
g n
( x )
,

Math.text: ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + 2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) less= ((norm@(g _ n)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2) + ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * d * s

para.p: Let

Math.text: y * t = ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + 2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))

para.p:
By the inequality we just established we have, for all
t
,

Math.text: y * t less= ((norm@(g _ n)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) less= ((norm@(g _ n)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(y * s * differential-d@(s))
y * t

((norm@(g _ n)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))
((norm@(g _ n)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(y * s * differential-d@(s))

para.p: By Gronwall’s inequality, we get

Math.text: y * t less= (((norm@(g _ n)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))) * e ^ t

para.p:
As
≤
∥
g n
∥
L 2
∥ g ∥
L 2
and
≤
∥
⁢
f n
( ⋅ , s )
∥
L 2
∥
⁢ f
( ⋅ , s )
∥
L 2
(these two facts follow from Parseval’s identity), it follows that

Math.text: y * t less= (((norm@(g)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))) * e ^ t

para.p:
Therefore, if
0 ≤ t ≤ T
then

Math.text: ((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + 2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) less= (((norm@(g)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))) * e ^ T less= (((norm@(g)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((norm@(f)) _ [L2(0,T;L2(T)]) ^ 2) * e ^ T = M
((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + 2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))
(((norm@(g)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))) * e ^ T

para.p: By Parseval’s identity,

Math.text: (sum _ (k element-of Z))@((absolute-value@(widehat@(u _ n) * open-interval@(k, t))) ^ 2) + 2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@((sum _ (k element-of Z))@((absolute-value@(widehat@(u _ (n * x)) * open-interval@(k, s))) ^ 2 * d * s)) less= M

para.p:
hence for all
t
,

Math.text: (sum _ (k element-of Z))@((absolute-value@(widehat@(u _ n) * open-interval@(k, t))) ^ 2) + 2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@((sum _ (k element-of Z))@(k ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(widehat@(u _ n) * open-interval@(k, s))) ^ 2 * d * s)) less= M

para.p:
If
k ≤ n ≤ m
, then
=
⁢
^
u n
( k , t )
⁢
^
u m
( k , t )
for all
t
. Define
⁢
^ u
( k , t )
by

Math.text: hat@(u) * open-interval@(k, t) = (limit _ (n to infinity))@(widehat@(u _ n) * open-interval@(k, t)) = widehat@(u _ k) * open-interval@(k, t)

para.p:
Thus, for all
t
,

Math.text: (sum _ (k element-of Z))@((absolute-value@(hat@(u) * open-interval@(k, t))) ^ 2) + 2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@((sum _ (k element-of Z))@(k ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(hat@(u) * open-interval@(k, s))) ^ 2 * d * s)) less= M

para.p:
Then, for some
=
M ′
⁢
M ′
( f , g , T )
,

Math.text: ((integral _ 0) ^ T)@((sum _ (k element-of Z))@((absolute-value@(hat@(u) * open-interval@(k, t))) ^ 2)) + (sum _ (k element-of Z))@(k ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(hat@(u) * open-interval@(k, t))) ^ 2 * d * t) less= M ^ prime

para.p:
It follows that for almost all
t
, there is some
∈ u
⁢
H 1
( T )
whose Fourier coefficients are
⁢
^ u
( k , t )
, and that we have

Math.text: ((integral _ 0) ^ T)@(((norm@(u * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (H ^ 1)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(t)) less= M ^ prime

para.p: We have

Math.text: (limit _ (n to infinity))@(((integral _ 0) ^ T)@(((norm@(u _ n * open-interval@(cdot, t) - u * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (H ^ 1)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(t))) = 0

para.p: i.e.

Math.text: (limit _ (n to infinity))@(((norm@(u _ n - u)) _ (L ^ 2 * vector@(0, T, H ^ 1 * T))) ^ 2) = 0

para.p:
Multiply () by
⁢
u
⁢ n x x
( x , t )
and integrate over
T
. We get, for almost all
t
,

Math.text: (integral _ T)@(u _ (n * t) * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x)) - (integral _ T)@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x)) = (integral _ T)@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x))

para.p: As

Math.text: (integral _ T)@(u _ (n * t) * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x)) = - (integral _ T)@(u _ (n * t * x) * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x)) = - (1 / 2) * (d / (d * t)) * (integral _ T)@(u _ (n * x) * (open-interval@(x, t)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(x))

para.p: we have

Math.text: - pi * (d / (d * t)) * ((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 - 2 * pi * ((norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 = (integral _ T)@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, t) * u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(x, t) * differential-d@(x))

para.p:
Integrating from
0
to
t
,

Math.text: ((- pi * ((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2) + pi * ((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, 0))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2) - 2 * pi * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) = ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@((integral _ T)@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, s) * u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(x, s) * differential-d@(x)))

para.p:
For almost all
s
,

Math.text: (integral _ T)@(absolute-value@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, s) * u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(x, s)) * differential-d@(x)) less= 2 * pi * (norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2) * (norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2) less= 2 * pi * (((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 / 2 + ((norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 / 2) = pi * ((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + pi * ((norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2
(integral _ T)@(absolute-value@(f _ n * open-interval@(x, s) * u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(x, s)) * differential-d@(x))
2 * pi * (norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2) * (norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)
2 * pi * (((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 / 2 + ((norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 / 2)
pi * ((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + pi * ((norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2

para.p:
It follows that, for all
t
,

Math.text: pi * ((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * x + 2 * pi * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) less= pi * ((norm@((g _ n) ^ prime)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + pi * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2) + ((norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * d * s

para.p: Hence

Math.text: ((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) less= ((norm@((g _ n) ^ prime)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) less= ((norm@(g)) _ (H ^ 1)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s)) less= ((norm@(g)) _ (H ^ 1)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ T)@(((norm@(f * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))
((norm@(u _ (n * x) * open-interval@(cdot, t))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(u _ (n * x * x) * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))
((norm@((g _ n) ^ prime)) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f _ n * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))
((norm@(g)) _ (H ^ 1)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(((norm@(f * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))
((norm@(g)) _ (H ^ 1)) ^ 2 + ((integral _ 0) ^ T)@(((norm@(f * open-interval@(cdot, s))) _ (L ^ 2)) ^ 2 * differential-d@(s))

para.p:
Using Parseval’s identity we have, for all
t
,

Each of the four norms has limit

Math.text: widehat@(u _ t) * open-interval@(k, t) - widehat@(u _ (n * t)) * open-interval@(k, t) = (sum _ (absolute-value@(k) > n) - k ^ 2 * e ^ (- k ^ 2 * t) * hat@(g) * k - k ^ 2 * e ^ (- k ^ 2 * t) * ((integral _ 0) ^ t)@(e ^ (k ^ 2 * s) * hat@(f) * open-interval@(k, s) * differential-d@(s))) + e ^ (- k ^ 2 * t) * e ^ (k ^ 2 * t) * hat@(f) * open-interval@(k, t) = (sum _ (absolute-value@(k) > n) - k ^ 2 * hat@(u) * open-interval@(k, t)) + hat@(f) * open-interval@(k, t)

+ e ^ (- k ^ 2 * t) * e ^ (k ^ 2 * t) * hat@(f) * open-interval@(k, t)

2 * ((integral _ 0) ^ T)@((sum _ (absolute-value@(k) > n))@(k ^ 2 * (absolute-value@(hat@(u) * open-interval@(k, t))) ^ 2)) + (absolute-value@(hat@(f) * open-interval@(k, t))) ^ 2 * d * t
